p: Venezuela HF emerged in 1989, with several cases that occurred in the central plains of Venezuela. A new Guanarito virus was isolated and named after the region where the first outbreak occurred (Salas etÂ al. 1991). The main affected populations are settlers moving into cleared forest areas to practice small agriculture. Zygodontomys brevicauda appears to be the principal host (i.e.: reservoir) of the virus.
